| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 172](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/v0.8.3/src/monst.c#L172) |

A **queen ant**, a, is a type [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). The queen ant is a rare type of [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned") [insect](/wiki/Insect "Insect") that is a [prince](/wiki/Prince "Prince") to her kind.

A queen ant has a strong bite attack and a and [poisonous](/wiki/Poison "Poison") sting, and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

A queen ant is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to [eat](/wiki/Eat "Eat"), but eating a queen [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") confers 1⁄20 [additional poison resistance](/wiki/Partial_intrinsic "Partial intrinsic").

## Generation

Queen ants are not randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

A solitary queen ant is generated in an [anthole](/wiki/Anthole "Anthole") at level creation, where she is guarded by the rest of the ants within.

## Strategy

Queen ants have the typical high speed associated with [Team Ant](/wiki/Team_Ant "Team Ant"), moving twice as fast as normal characters and possessing two decently-damaging attacks. They lack [monster magic resistance](/wiki/Monster_magic_resistance "Monster magic resistance") of any kind, but players looking to take advantage must hit through a solid [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") of -8.

## Encyclopedia entry

This giant variety of the ordinary ant will fight just as  
fiercely as its small, distant cousin. Various varieties  
exist, and they are known and feared for their relentless  
persecution of their victims.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Queen_ant\&action=edit)*

From NetHackWiki

a queen ant (No tile)
Difficulty 16
Attacks Bite 3d8, Sting 3d4 poison
a queen ant (No tile)
Difficulty 16
Attacks

Bite 3d8, Sting 3d4 poison

Base level 14
Base experience 425
Speed 24
Base AC -8
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 100
Nutritional value 100
Size Small
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison (+5%)

A queen ant:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is an overlord to its kind.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
Reference EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 172

A queen ant, a, is a type monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. The queen ant is a rare type of oviparous thick-skinned insect that is a prince to her kind.

A queen ant has a strong bite attack and a and poisonous sting, and possesses poison resistance.

A queen ant is poisonous to eat, but eating a queen corpse or tin confers 1⁄20 additional poison resistance.

Generation

Queen ants are not randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

A solitary queen ant is generated in an anthole at level creation, where she is guarded by the rest of the ants within.

Strategy

Queen ants have the typical high speed associated with Team Ant, moving twice as fast as normal characters and possessing two decently-damaging attacks. They lack monster magic resistance of any kind, but players looking to take advantage must hit through a solid AC of -8.

Encyclopedia entry

This giant variety of the ordinary ant will fight just as
fiercely as its small, distant cousin. Various varieties
exist, and they are known and feared for their relentless
persecution of their victims.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''queen ant''', {{cyan|a}}, is a type [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. The queen ant is a rare type of [[oviparous]] [[thick-skinned]] [[insect]] that is a [[prince]] to her kind.

A queen ant has a strong bite attack and a and [[poison]]ous sting, and possesses [[poison resistance]].

A queen ant is [[poisonous]] to [[eat]], but eating a queen [[corpse]] or [[tin]] confers {{frac|20}} [[Partial intrinsic|additional poison resistance]].

==Generation==
Queen ants are not randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

A solitary queen ant is generated in an [[anthole]] at level creation, where she is guarded by the rest of the ants within.

==Strategy==
Queen ants have the typical high speed associated with [[Team Ant]], moving twice as fast as normal characters and possessing two decently-damaging attacks. They lack [[monster magic resistance]] of any kind, but players looking to take advantage must hit through a solid [[AC]] of -8.

	exist, and they are known and feared for their relentless
	persecution of their victims.
